data.title: The Official Samsung Galaxy Site
data.meta_description: Meet the new Galaxy S24, S24+ and S24 Ultra. Explore the rest of the Galaxy ecosystem and discover epic accessories.
data.text:
Galaxy Z Fold5 l Z Flip5: Official Introduction Film Play button

A message window between a user and an AI chatbot. Introducing Galaxy Z Flip5 and Fold5. The two devices are shown folded. They rotate between front and back views. When focused on the Galaxy Z Flip5 front, bright light beams from the Flex Window. Next, a virtual gallery features artwork depicting Galaxy Z Flip5. In the center is what appears to be a statue of the device. The statue comes to life with the device folding, flipping and twirling, each time pausing to focus on a different feature of the phone. Disclaimer: Image simulated. Color availability may vary depending on country, region, or carrier. Next, a cloud of social media posts reviewing the device. Back in the AI chat from the beginning, the AI chatbot shares a video of people easily sliding the folded Galaxy Z Flip5 into and out of their various pockets: front pockets, a back pocket, a small purse. Disclaimer: Image simulated. UX/UI subject to change. Next, a small digital window begins with one happy emoji, which then shows surprise when the window becomes crowded with an avalanche of emojis. The window pops out into an expanded window covering the front panel of Galaxy Z Flip5. The display is 3.78 times larger than the display of the previous model. The display continues to show supportive, positive and excited emojis. Disclaimer: Image simulated. Compared to previous Galaxy Z Flip models. Then, the display shows a selfie with a camera icon in the lower right hand corner. Various other custom clock styles fan out from behind the device. Next, clock styles are featured one at a time on the display with increasing speed, including a whimsical 3D flower character, then custom frame clock styles with photos used in the background. Disclaimer: Image simulated. UX/UI subject to change. Finally, the device shakes and turns to the Multi Widget View screen with widgets tiled on the display. Disclaimer: Image simulated. UX/UI subject to change. Certain widgets must be enabled in device settings. The device shakes again and the media player widget opens with playback controls and a progress bar. Disclaimer: Image simulated. UX/UI subject to change. YouTube Music is a trademark of Google LLC. A text message notification comes down from the top of the screen, then opens into a quick reply window with a qwerty keyboard to type out a reply message. Then, Galaxy Z Flip5 is held folded in-hand for a selfie taken from the Flex Window. The user goes into the gallery from the shortcut at the bottom right. Then flips through gallery photos, favorites one, and deletes another. Next, Galaxy Z Flip5 is placed on the floor in Flex Mode to take a FlexCam selfie of two people. Then, it is held in hand like a camcorder to take a dance video where the subjects can see themselves in the Flex Window preview. Then, it is placed on the floor and standing up like a tent for a solo selfie. Zooming into an extreme close-up of the cameras, then the Flex Window, a user wearing Galaxy Watch6 uses the Camera Controller on their watch to snap photos from the Galaxy Z Flip5. A group selfie is taken. A 360 view of the device zooms out to a flat lay of a lineup of Galaxy Z Flip5 devices in various positions and showcasing different widgets and custom interfaces. Disclaimer: Image simulated. UX/UI subject to change. Flex mode supported at angles between 75 degrees and 115 degrees. Galaxy Watch6 sold separately. Certain widgets must be enabled in device settings. YouTube Music is a trademark of Google LLC. Sequence shortened. Then, among the Galaxy Z Flip5 devices, Galaxy Z Fold5 appears in Flex Mode with the Camera app open. The focus centers on the device’s Main Screen, which closes on itself and seemingly turns off the lights. The folded device lifts and rotates to show the Cover Screen, then twirls to zoom in on the Flex Hinge. The device opens to the Main Screen. Then folds again to show the folded hinge from the bottom. Disclaimer: Image simulated. Compared to previous Galaxy Z Fold models. Thickness measured from top to bottom of the glasses of Galaxy Z Fold5. Measured diagonally, Galaxy Z Fold’s main screen size is 7.6 inches in the full rectangle and 7.4 inches accounting for the rounded corners; actual viewable area is less due to the rounded corners and camera hole when Under Display Camera is in use. Returning to the AI chat from the beginning, the previous scene is uploaded as a video in the chat. To answer the user’s question, the AI chat skims through the feature information on the Samsung dot com Galaxy Z Fold5 website. Disclaimer: Image simulated. S Pen Fold Edition sold separately and is only compatible with Galaxy Z Fold5, Z Fold4 and Z Fold3. HoYoverse is a trademark and/or registered trademark of Cognosphere PTE. LTD. Genshin Impact requires separate download, available at Galaxy Store. Genshin Impact artworks are copyrighted and Cognosphere PTE. LTC. enjoys the exclusive rights. The AI chatbot replies with links to features of the new device. The user taps on “productivity.” AI uploads a video. In the video, Galaxy Z Fold5 is open to the Main Screen. S Pen Fold Edition for Galaxy Z Fold5 is used to tap on apps, like Samsung Notes, and drag apps into a split screen view of multiple apps. Then, zooming in to the task bar, more apps are added to the tray, including app pairs. The S Pen taps on an app pair icon, and the corresponding apps instantly open on the Main Screen at once. The device folds into Flex Mode, with Samsung Notes on the bottom and a video call in Google Meet on the top half. Back on the unfolded Main Screen, the screen is split between a calendar and a hand-drawn to-do list in Samsung Notes. Then a vertical social video with the comments open on the side. Disclaimer: Image simulated. UX/UI subject to change. S Pen Fold Edition sold separately and is only compatible with Galaxy Z Fold5, Z Fold4 and Z Fold3. Taskbar feature supported on the main screen only. Certain applications may not support multitasking or App Pair. Google Meet is a trademark of Google LLC. Microsoft Excel needs to be downloaded separately. Microsoft Outlook needs to be downloaded separately. TikTok is a trademark of ByteDance. The scene is uploaded as a video to the AI chat. Then, the user taps the “entertainment” button offered in the previous message. Another video file plays. A dramatic outer space scene plays on the Main Screen of an unfolding Galaxy Z Fold5, seen in an extreme closeup. The view zooms out to show the completely unfolded Main Screen, then quickly zooms in to the inside of the device to show the Snapdragon 8 Gen 2 Mobile Platform for Galaxy. Gameplay of an intense racing game plays on the Main Screen. Disclaimer: Image simulated. Snapdragon is a product of Qualcomm Technologies, Inc. and/or its subsidiaries. Certain games may not be optimized for full screen. Copyright 2023 Gameloft. All Rights Reserved. All manufacturers, cars, names, brands and associated imagery are trademarks and/or copyrighted materials of their respective owners. The perspective zooms out, passing various screens and app interfaces with increasing speed, until it warps out and lands back in the AI chat. Disclaimer: Image simulated. When the AI bot is asked its opinion, a “loading” circle turns into the “o” in “Join the flip side.” Next, Galaxy Z Fold5 and Galaxy Z Flip5 appear and unfold. Galaxy Z Fold5 unfolds to the Main Screen. On the display is a note-taking app with an illustrated composition made of a photo and handwritten text that reads, "Unfold your world." Galaxy Z Flip5 is in Flex Mode and seen from the Flex Window which shows a selfie. As they unfold, a second Galaxy Z Fold5, folded and seen from the rear, emerges from behind the first device. An S Pen Fold Edition for Galaxy Z Fold5 leans on the side. Samsung dot com. Disclaimer: Image simulated for illustrative purposes. S Pen Fold Edition sold separately and is only compatible with Galaxy Z Fold5, Z Fold4 and Z Fold3.
